rComments: Vera is rad. She has a very passionate teaching style and applies a radical political lens to her subjects, which is appropriate when teaching about latin america. her political involvement in latin american struggles makes her an essential professor for anyone interested in latin american history, or radical politics.

I have taken two classes with Vera. There is a lot of reading, but I made it through without doing much of it. She is the most articulate and passionate professor I have had thus far. She does sport a blatant and outspoken political bias, but if you can look past that, you will be in for a very challenging and intellectually stimulating quarter.

She's knowlagleble, however, she is not organized as a Professor. Her lack of organizational skills affect her lectures. Furthermore, during her lecture she jumps around from time periods and her study guides sucks.
VERY KNOWLEDGABLE, FUNNY, AND HELPFUL. HOWEVER, BE WELL PREPARED FOR EXAMES THEY ARE INVOLVED AND LOOKS FOR DETAILS (DATES NAMES) BUT IS VERY HELPFUL IF U MEET WITH HER BEFOREHAND.

Really smart.  She is leftist in her views but she in really intelligent.  Her lectures are very well prepared and the class is intense.  SHe curses all the time which keeps people awake.  Her class is super interesting.  Not that much work but there is a lot of books to read.  Recomend if interested in US foreign policy towards Latin America.
